intro: Nonea pulla subsp. macrantha, commonly known as the purple-flowered Nonea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
